issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Eucaconsole does not always load the latest IE mode

comments.body:
IE 11 will fall back to IE7 mode when on a corporate network with an intranet "zone" detected by IE, and a meta tag won't help here AFAICT. 
See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27272454/ie11-document-mode-defaults-to-ie7-how-to-reset
I discovered this only seems to happen on my Win7 VM which is connected to the corporate network.

I found a work-around for this so changing the Priority to major.  I was able to get the UI to load by going into Internet Options -> Connections -> LAN settings and disabling the automatic configuration script.  After I restarted IE, I was able to login to the console.
[~tvo], might want to note in KI.
[~teejalon], if your users have trouble connecting to 4.2 via IE11, see the workaround mentioned in the comments above and everything should be fine.

[~jloza] To clarify, this will affect rendering, not connectivity.

The X-UA-Compatible mode can be delivered as an HTTP header.  Investigating.
We may be able to add the HTML5 doctype in our master template, per http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13746872/how-do-you-specify-the-html5-doctype-with-python-chameleon
I configured the changes done in the PR manually and it seems to have fixed the problem.  I have not seen other issues so far.
Added to KI for 4.2 with workaround for both methods 1) through the browser settings and 2) through adding a line in the nginx file.
have nginx.conf change, meed meta tag as well for completeness and sanity...

Verified.  This is working.  I didn't change anything my IE web browser and the console loaded fine.
{code}
[root@g-15-03 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole/console.ini
